oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Organic Farming in Europe by 2010: Scenarios for the future
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Zanoli, R.
Gambelli, D.
Vairo, D.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Farm economics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: How will organic farming in Europe evolve by the year 2010? The answer provides a basis for the development of different policy options and for anticipating the future relative competitiveness of organic and conventional farming. The authors tackle the question using an innovative approach based on scenario analysis, offering the reader a range of scenarios that encompass the main possible evolutions of the organic farming sector. This book constitutes an innovative and reliable decision-supporting tool for policy makers, farmers and the private sector. Researchers and students operating in the field of agricultural economics will also benefit from the methodological approach adopted for the scenario analysis.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Zanoli, R.; Gambelli, D. and Vairo, D. (2000) Organic Farming in Europe by 2010: Scenarios for the future. Organic Farming in Europe: Economics and Policy, no. Vol. 8. Universität Hohenheim, Stuttgart - Hohenheim.
